Diffusion-based Generative Model
\[\begin{aligned} q(x_t | x_{t-1}) &= \mathcal{N_{\theta}}\left(x_t\right) \\ q(x_{1:T}|x_0) &= \prod_{t=1}^T q(x_t | x_{t-1}) \end{aligned}\]

The noise kernel $\mathcal{N}$ is usually a Gaussian noise as it has an additive property for samples $x_t$ drawn as $t\to âˆž$ results to standard Gaussian distribution.
